H0.text: From Dec.29th 2011 which country will move forward a time zone, a move designed to help trade with China, Australia and New Zealand. Kiribati

H1.text: From Dec.29th 2011 which country will move forward a time zone, a move designed to help trade with China, Australia and New Zealand. Tonga

H2.text: From Dec.29th 2011 which country will move forward a time zone, a move designed to help trade with China, Australia and New Zealand. Fiji

H3.text: From Dec.29th 2011 which country will move forward a time zone, a move designed to help trade with China, Australia and New Zealand. Samoa

A4.text: In 1995, Kiribati unilaterally moved the International Date Line far to the east to encompass the Line Islands group, so that the country would no longer be divided by the date line.

A5.text: The revision of Kiribati's time zone meant that the international date line in effect moved 1,000 kilometers (620 mi) eastwards to go around this country.

A6.text: At the end of December 2011, Samoa changed its time zone offset from UTCâˆ’11 to UTC+13, effectively jumping forward by one day, omitting Friday, 30 December from the local calendar.

A7.text: This also changed the shape of the International Date Line, moving it to the east of the territory.
